opening sentence.3: << You will find Little(o) only after closing. >>

opening sentence.1: << Come on in. Let me know if you need anything, or take a seat by the fire and I'll send someone over. >>
opening sentence.2: << Come on in. Just stoked the fire. Take a seat and get the cold out. >>
opening sentence.3: << Welcome. Let me know if you want anything... think I got a clean mug around here somewhere. >>
opening sentence.4: << Come on in. We got warm food, warm drinks, and warm beds. >>

opening sentence.1: << Stock up here before your next kill. >>
opening sentence.2: << Now in stock: goods acquired through questionable means. >>
opening sentence.3: << Get your raiding supplies here. Or don't, I don't care. >>
opening sentence.4: << Have a hard day of killing and looting? Don't want to haul it all back yourself? Sell it here. >>
opening sentence.5: << It's dangerous to go alone. It's dangerous to go in groups. It's just dangerous out there, so stock up here. >>
opening sentence.6: << Reminder: Any attempted five finger discounts will be reclaimed and paid for with said fingers. >>

opening sentence.1: << Trinkets, odds and ends, that sort of thing. >>
opening sentence.2: << Oh, a bit of this and a bit of that. >>

opening sentence.1: << Give your bodies to Atom, my friends. Release yourself to his power, feel his Glow and be Divided. >>
opening sentence.2: << Come forth and drink the waters of the Glow, for this ancient weapon of war is our salvation, it is the very symbol of Atom's glory! >>
opening sentence.3: << Behold! He's coming with the clouds! And every eye shall be blind with his glory! Every ear shall be stricken deaf to hear the thunder of his voice! >>
opening sentence.4: << Yea, your suffering shall exist no longer; it shall be washed away in Atom's Glow, burned from you in the fire of his brilliance. >>
opening sentence.5: << Each of us shall give birth to a billion stars formed from the mass of our wretched and filthy bodies. >>
opening sentence.6: << Atom reached out and touched this world, bringing his Glow to us. It remains to this day, a reminder of his promise. Infinite worlds through divisions. >>
